0efUq8OwvPHDRdzTR1HyCQ.text: Best sub place in Charlotte hands down. Had the chicken philly with fries it was great closest thing I had to back home

xhLS0N_uOG1usORg6DLtgg.text: I was craving a philly cheese steak and penn station does it the very best! Their meat is used from rib eye steak and they shave it using a meat slicer grill it on the flat top you get your choice of veggies and sauce. Theirs also different sizes of subs I got the six inch with a small order of fries. The fries do taste fresh there Idaho potato blanched in water then fried in peanut oil. I would recommend this place there's monthly specials where you get a sub chips and drink for $6.99

photos.caption: Photo of Penn Station East Coast Subs - Charlotte, NC, United States. Philly cheesesteak

Os-2_92W-cRhWwTXMo4TNg.text: My favorite chain sub shop. The owner is often behind the counter taking orders. Very rare nowadays you see owners roll up their sleeves and work side by side with the employees. Very nice and friendly gentleman. My son and I usually get the same sandwich because to Us it's perfection. The Italian with a  side of fries for us to split. Great place. Love the new location. Looking forward to many more visits.

WNoYpjxfS-wE--ASg0HUxA.text: I'm going to make this review short and sweet. Tonight was our first time.  We ordered three Italian subs.  Best sub I've ever eaten.  My other two family members agreed.  Simply incredible!!!

99T34z609ySflXLN0BynUA.text: Penn Station hands down makes the best subs in Charlotte. I have brought many of my friends here and they all agree with me. It is True that it may take a little longer to get your sub here than at another sandwich place, but the quality that Penn Station produces simply cannot be replicated.

XeP3Ac5X3hwt5XovBkjVwA.text: I was very hungry and craving a good philly style sandwich from a place that specialises in such masterpieces. No need for confusion, or asking for any specialty items, I simply said just make it the way you make it! Big mistake. Very hungry and short on time for lunch I get back to my truck and find that my Philly sandwich has tomato sauce on it. Please read this little insert on how to make an original Philly that I found:  In general, tomato sauce is not a regular part of a cheesesteak when served in Philadelphia. (A "pizza steak" with mozz and marinara is a popular thing, but it's not the same.)   You know it was very low portions in there was hardly any meat, a lot of sauce and a lot of peppers. Heartburn City, I will never make this mistake again there's plenty of other delicious places to get a Philly in Charlotte.
